dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5150 IH: Protecting Agricultural Borrower Information Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. McClain Delaney (for herself, Mr. Costa, Mr. Larson of Connecticut, and Ms. Elfreth) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To strengthen privacy protections for recipients of loans and payments processed by the Farm Service Agency.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Agricultural Borrower Information Act.

section.header: Strengthening of privacy protections for recipients of loans and payments processed by the Farm Service Agency
section.text: Section 339 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1989) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: It shall be unlawful for the Secretary or any officer or employee of the Farm Service Agency to disclose information provided pursuant to this Act by an applicant for, or a recipient of, a benefit under this Act, toâ€”

subparagraph.text: a special government employee, as defined in section 202 of title 18, United States Code; or
a government employee detailed to the Farm Service Agency under section 3341 of title 5 of such Code.

paragraph.text: Paragraph (1) shall not apply to any of the following:

subparagraph.header: Disclosure in statistical or aggregate form
subparagraph.text: Information that has been transformed into a statistical or aggregate form which does not allow identification of the provider.
Disclosure with the consent of the provider, if the consent is not provided a condition of participation in, or receipt of a benefit under, a program administered by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: Whoever knowingly violates this subsection shall be fined not more than $10,000, imprisoned not more than 1 year, or both.
